alert.note: Alert for Antelope; Boone; Madison; Pierce; Platte; Stanton (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 24 at 2:45AM CDT until June 24 at 3:30AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: The National Weather Service in Omaha has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Madison County in northeastern Nebraska... Northern Platte County in northeastern Nebraska... Pierce County in northeastern Nebraska... Antelope County in northeastern Nebraska... Boone County in northeastern Nebraska... Southwestern Stanton County in northeastern Nebraska... * Until 330 AM CDT. * At 245 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles south of Page to 10 miles northeast of Bartlett to 6 miles south of Spalding, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Cedar Rapids, Orchard and Primrose around 255 AM CDT. Elgin and Petersburg around 300 AM CDT. Albion around 305 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Oakdale, Tilden, St. Edward, Plainview, Meadow Grove, Lindsay, Battle Creek, Osmond and Humphrey. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Antelope; Boone; Madison; Pierce; Platte; Stanton
